oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Successful Control of Johne's Disease in Nine Wisconsin Dairy Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eggleston, Vic
Collins, Michael T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johne's Disease
control program
affordable
management style
disease control
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: There is general consensus on how to control Johne's Disease (JD) but there are few longitudinal field studies to demonstrate that such recommendations actually work. The goal of the project was to fill this need by testing a single specific affordable control program in ten Wisconsin commercial dairy herds with diverse sizes and management styles.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2006; 325
